.NET Framework 3.5.name: VRTK_Pointer
.NET Framework 3.5.summary: The VRTK Pointer class forms the basis of being able to emit a pointer from a game object (e.g. controller).
.NET Framework 3.5.remarks:
The concept of the pointer is it can be activated and deactivated and used to select elements utilising different button combinations if required.

 The Pointer requires a Pointer Renderer which is the visualisation of the pointer in the scene. 
 
 A Pointer can also be used to extend the interactions of an interacting object such as a controller. This enables pointers to touch (and highlight), grab and use interactable objects. 
 
 The Pointer script does not need to go on a controller game object, but if it's placed on another object then a controller must be provided to determine what activates the pointer. 
 
 It extends the `VRTK_DestinationMarker` to allow for destination events to be emitted when the pointer cursor collides with objects.

methods.name: CanActivate()
methods.summary: The CanActivate method is used to determine if the pointer has passed the activation time limit.
methods.returns: Returns true if the pointer can be activated.

methods.name: CanSelect()
methods.summary: The CanSelect method is used to determine if the pointer has passed the selection time limit.
methods.returns: Returns true if the pointer can execute the select action.

FindController()
GetCursorRotation()

HandleEnabledPointer()
IsActivationButtonPressed()
methods.summary: The IsActivationButtonPressed method returns whether the configured activation button is being pressed.
methods.returns: Returns true if the activationButton is being pressed.

methods.name: IsPointerActive()
methods.summary: The IsPointerActive method is used to determine if the pointer's current state is active or not.
methods.returns: Returns true if the pointer is currently active.

methods.name: IsSelectionButtonPressed()
methods.summary: The IsSelectionButtonPressed method returns whether the configured activation button is being pressed.
methods.returns: Returns true if the selectionButton is being pressed.

methods.name: IsStateValid()
methods.summary: The IsStateValid method is used to determine if the pointer is currently in a valid state (i.e. on it's valid colour).
methods.returns: Returns true if the pointer is in the valid state (showing the valid colour), returns false if the pointer is in the invalid state (showing the invalid colour).

methods.name: OnDisable()
OnEnable()
PointerEnter(RaycastHit givenHit)
methods.summary: The PointerEnter method emits a DestinationMarkerEnter event when the pointer first enters a valid object, it emits a DestinationMarkerHover for every following frame that the pointer stays over the valid object.

methods.name: PointerExit(RaycastHit givenHit)
methods.summary: The PointerExit method emits a DestinationMarkerExit event when the pointer leaves a previously entered object.

methods.name: ResetActivationTimer(bool forceZero)
methods.summary: The ResetActivationTimer method is used to reset the pointer activation timer to the next valid activation time.

params.value: If this is true then the next activation time will be 0.

methods.name: ResetSelectionTimer(bool forceZero)
methods.summary: The ResetSelectionTimer method is used to reset the pointer selection timer to the next valid activation time.

params.value: If this is true then the next activation time will be 0.

methods.summary: The Toggle method is used to enable or disable the pointer.

params.value: If true the pointer will be enabled if possible, if false the pointer will be disabled if possible.

events.name: ActivationButtonPressed
events.summary: Emitted when the pointer activation button is pressed.

events.name: ActivationButtonReleased
